DataElement.preferredName: Eligibility Criteria Last Five Years Prior Malignant Neoplasm Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Eligibility criteria indicator of whether or not the patient had a prior malignancy within the last five years.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Last Five Year Prior Malignant Neoplasm
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one._A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period._Earlier in time or order._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Last Five Year Prior Malignant Neoplasm
Property.preferredDefinition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.:A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.:Earlier in time or order.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Concepts.definition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for 1403 study in Rave per request by J.Zhao.mc 8/14/15

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable
